alert.note: Alert for Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 30 at 10:21PM MST until July 31 at 12:30AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... * Until 1230 AM MST. * At 1021 PM MST, gauge reports indicated significant floodwaters moving through Cave Creek and other surrounding washes. A water rescue was performed along 7th Avenue near Coral Gables. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Phoenix, Glendale, Deer Valley Airport, Metro Center Mall and North Mountain Park. This includes the following highways... AZ Route 101 between mile markers 18 and 26. AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 209 and 218. This includes the following streams and drainages... Skunk Creek, Apache Wash, Cave Creek, New River and North Canyon Creek. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
